document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the spider genera Agyneta and Tennesseellum (Araneae, Linyphiidae) of North America north of Mexico with a study of the embolic division within Micronetinae sensu Saaristo & Tanasevitch 1996

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material:
Erigone fabra
Keyserling 1886
, 3 HOLOTYPE . ( BMNH ), NOT EXAMINED .

Diagnosis: Males can be differentiated from all other species in
Agyneta
by the presence of a mastidion (
Figs 21
, 395 ), from other species of the group by the rugose, equal sized dorsal and ventral cymbial tubercles (
Fig. 391
). Females can be distinguished from other
Agyneta
species by their abdominal pattern (
Fig. 396
), from other species of the group and
A. regina
by the presence of a shallow or deep pit hook depression (
Figs 397, 398
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 380–389.
Agyneta micaria (Emerton, 1882)
. 380–384, Male. 385–389, Female. 380. Palp, retrolateral view. 381. Palp, prolateral view. 382. Embolus, prolateral view. 383. Radical division, retrolateral view. 384. 385. Abdomen, dorsal view. 386. Epigynum, ventral view. 387. Internal genitalia, ventral view. 388. Internal genitalia, dorsal view. 389. Distal part of scape, posterior view.

FIGURES 390–401.
Agyneta fabra (Keyserling 1886)
. 390–395, Male. 396–401, Female. 390. Palp, retrolateral view. 391. Palp, prolateral view. 392. Embolus, prolateral view. 393. Radical division, retrolateral view. 394. Abdomen, dorsal view. 395 . Cephalothorax, anterior view (arrow points to mastidion). 396. Abdomen, dorsal view. 397. 398. Variation of epigynum, ventral view. 399. Internal genitalia, ventral view. 400. Internal genitalia, dorsal view. 401. Distal part of scape, posterior view.

Male
:
Total length 2.64; carapace length 1.15, width 0.80.

Female :
Total length 2.46; carapace length 0.972 , width 0.753 .
